meanings.definition: A person who is highly influential in lobbying activities.
meanings.sent1: The superlobbyist was able to persuade many politicians to support the new law.
meanings.sent2: The superlobbyist attended multiple meetings to advocate for the interests of their clients.
meanings.sent3: The superlobbyist walked into the room with confidence, ready to negotiate for their cause.
meanings.sent4: She was like a superlobbyist, weaving through the corridors of power with ease.
meanings.sent5: The image of the superlobbyist in a sharp suit became synonymous with political influence.

meanings.definition: To act as a superlobbyist in order to advance a particular agenda.
meanings.sent1: He decided to superlobbyist for the environmental protection bill.
meanings.sent2: She superlobbyisted tirelessly to secure funding for the community project.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends joked that they should superlobbyist for a pizza party.
meanings.sent4: The candidate promised to superlobbyist for better healthcare access for all.
meanings.sent5: The students planned to superlobbyist their school administration for longer lunch breaks.
